title: Bug 151938 Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully
description: Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode. This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this issue (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...)
OB: If you start a Java 5 VM with AspectJ's load-time weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, it chokes badly. It tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. If the script is wrapped twice, it can generate a duplicate.
EB: The software should handle duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully. Instead of attempting to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emitting excessive bytecode, it should fail and display an error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Start a Java 5 VM.
2. Specify AspectJ's load-time weaver more than once using the javaagent flag.
3. Ensure there is an aop.xml file defined.
4. Observe the software choking and emitting massive amounts of bytecode.
